intro: Xerochrysum interiore, commonly known as the golden effleur, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow to gold-colored flowers. The plant is perennial and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in coastal areas. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The plant is popular in gardens for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
